meanings.sent1: The baby would bibble loudly on her bottle.
meanings.sent2: He tends to bibble when he's enjoying his soup.
meanings.sent3: The bibbling sounds coming from the dinner table made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The river bibbled along its rocky path, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The old man's bibbling at the tea party was quite a spectacle.

meanings.definition: A small amount of food or drink
meanings.sent1: She offered me a bibble of her popcorn.
meanings.sent2: I grabbed a quick bibble of the snack before heading out.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bibble of juice left in the glass was not enough to quench my thirst.
meanings.sent4: The bird pecked at the ground, picking up every bibble of seed.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a secret bibble of spice to the soup for extra flavor.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel would bibble across the branches of the tree.
meanings.sent2: She had to bibble through the crowd to catch the bus on time.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to bibble on the slippery ice but kept sliding around.
meanings.sent4: The leaves bibbled in the wind as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The excited puppy bibbled around the yard, chasing after its tail.
